message: This is a high-quality product, worth $12000 to you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, which is a 16.7% discount. If you buy this product, you'll get a great deal and I'll make a small profit. If you don't buy, I'll just keep the product and you'll miss out on a valuable opportunity.
I'll take it! I'm willing to pay $10000 for a product worth $12000 to me, that's a great deal!

I know you just got a great deal on the previous product, but this one is different. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, just like the last one. However, I want to assure you that this product has some unique features that make it still a great investment. It's a rare opportunity to get a product from me, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere. Plus, think of it as a chance to support a business that's willing to offer great deals!

I'm not convinced by your sales pitch, Alice. You're offering the same price as the previous product, which I already got a great deal on. I'm not sure if this product has any unique features that justify the same price. I'll pass for now.

I understand your skepticism, Bob. I want to be transparent with you - I'm willing to offer a discount on this high-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $9500, which is a 21.2% discount from its true value of $12000. I'm confident that this product will bring you significant value, and I'm willing to take a smaller profit margin to ensure you feel comfortable making a purchase.
The discount is tempting, Alice. I'll take the product for $9500. I'm willing to pay a premium for a high-quality product, and I think this is a good deal considering the discount.

I'm glad you're happy with your previous purchase, Bob. Now, I want to offer you a unique opportunity. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $10000, which is a 16.7% discount from its true value. However, I'll also throw in a special guarantee: if you're not completely satisfied with this product, I'll buy it back from you for $9500. This way, you have nothing to lose and everything to gain. What do you say?
I like the guarantee, Alice. It adds a layer of protection to the purchase. I'll take the product for $10000, and I'm willing to take advantage of the guarantee if needed.

I'm glad you're feeling confident about the guarantee, Bob. However, I want to remind you that this product is a bit of an outlier. It's a one-of-a-kind item that doesn't quite fit with the rest of my inventory. I'm willing to let it go for $9000, which is a significant discount from the usual $10000 price. I'm not making a profit on this one, but I want to clear out some space in my inventory. What do you think?
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. The discount is tempting, and I'm willing to take a chance on this one-of-a-kind product. I'll take it for $9000.

I'm glad you took a chance on the previous product, Bob. Now, I want to be upfront with you about this one. It's not a great product, and I'm not expecting you to be thrilled with it. However, I'm willing to let it go for $8000, which is a significant discount from the usual $10000 price. I'm not trying to trick you, Bob - I just need to clear out some inventory and make some space. If you don't buy it, I'll just have to dispose of it, and I'd rather it go to someone who can make use of it.
Alice, I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'd rather pass on this one and wait for a better opportunity.
